episode_title: 115 - The One With the Stoned Guy

content.description: Central Perk, Rachel is serving Joey, Ross, and Monica their drinks.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Coffee. (Hands it to him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Cappuccino. (Hands it to him.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Grazie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And a nice hot cider for Monica. (Hands it to her.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Aww, thank you. (Notices something.) Uh Rach?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why does my cinamon stick have an eraser?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! That’s why. (Rachel checks behind her ear, and finds a cinamon stick.) I’m sorry!
(She takes the pencil out of Monica’s coffee and Monica puts her cup down in disgust.)

content.description: Chandler’s job, Chandler is typing data into his computer, he keeps typing even while taking a drink of coffee with one hand. One of his co-workers walks by.

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Chandler.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mrs. Tedlock. You’re looking lovely today. And may I say, that is a very flattering sleeve length on you.

content.speaker: Mrs. Tedlock
content.text: Yes. Well, Mr. Kostelick wants you to stop by his office at the end of the day.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, listen. If this is about those prank memos, I had nothing to do with them. Really. Nothing at all. Really. (Chandler tries to hide a rubber chicken from the woman.) Nothing.

content.description: Central Perk, everyone is there but Chandler. Phoebe runs in, excitedly.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys! Chandler’s coming and he says he has, like, this incredible news, so when he gets here, we could all act like, you know…
(Chandler comes in.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Never mind. But it was going to be really good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s going on?

content.speaker: All
content.text: What is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, it’s a typical day at work. I’m inputting my numbers, and big Al calls me into his office and tells me he wants to make me processing supervisor.

content.speaker: All
content.text: That’s great!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So… I quit.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why? This was supposed to be a temp job!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, Chandler… you’ve been there for five years.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If I took this promotion, it’d be like admitting that this is what I actually do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So was it a lot more money?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It doesn’t matter. I just don’t want to be one of those guys that’s in his office until twelve o’clock at night worrying about the WENUS.
(Everyone looks at him, confused.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: … the WENUS?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Weekly Estimated Net Usage Systems. A processing term.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. That WENUS.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So what’re you going to do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t know. That’s the thing. I don’t know what I want to do. I just know I’m not going to figure it out working there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oooh! I have something you can do! I have this new massage client… Steve? (pause) Anyway, he’s opening up a restaurant and he’s looking for a head chef.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Um… hi there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi! (turns back to Chandler, then to Monica) Oh, yeah, no, I know. You’re a chef. I know, and I thought of you first, but um, Chandler’s the one who needs a job right now, so…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah… I just don’t have that much cheffing experience. Unless it’s an all-toast restaurant.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what kind of food is he looking for?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, he wants to do some ecclectic, so he’s looking for someone who can, you know, create the entire menu.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I know! (turns to Chandler) So, what do you think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks, Phoebe. But I just don’t really see myself in a big white hat.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK. (pause) Oh Monica! Guess what!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler walks in, wearing a suit.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you see my nipples through this shirt?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. But don’t worry, I’m sure they’re still there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where are you going, Mr. Suity-Man?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I have an appointment to see Dr. Robert Pillman, career counselor a-gogo. (pause) I added the “a-gogo.”

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Career counselor?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you guys all know what you want to do.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, you guys in the living room all know what you want to do. You know, you have goals. You have dreams. I don’t have a dream.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah, the lesser-known “I don’t have a dream” speech.
(Monica enters, excited.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I love my life, I love my life!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! Brian’s Song !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: The meeting with the guy went great?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So great! He showed me where the restaurant’s going to be. It’s this, it’s this cute little place on 10th Street. Not too big, not too small. Just right.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Was it formerly owned by a blonde woman and some bears?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So anyway, I’m cooking dinner for him Monday night. You know, kind of like an audition. And Phoebe, he really wants you to be here, which will be great for me because then you can ‘ooh’ and ‘ahh’ and make yummy noises.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What are you going to make?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yummy noises.
content.parenthetical: as though Rachel wasn’t paying attention

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And Monica, what are you going to make?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know. I don’t know. It’s just going to be so great!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh! I know what you could make! (runs over to join Monica and Rachel in the kitchen) I know! Oh, you should definitely make that thing… you know, with the stuff? (Monica doesn’t know.) You know, that thing… with the stuff…? OK, I don’t know. (sits down)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey guys, does anybody know a good date place in the neighborhood?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How about Tony’s? If you can finish a 32-ounce steak, it’s free.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, ahem, hey, does anybody know a good place if you’re not dating a puma?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Who are you going out with?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, is this the bug lady?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bzzzz… I love you, Ross.
content.parenthetical: trying to sound like a bug

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Her name is Celia. She’s not a bug lady. She’s curator of insects at the museum.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So what are you guys going to do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I just thought we could go out to dinner, and then maybe bring her back to my place and I’d introduce her to my monkey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And he’s not speaking metaphorically.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So… back to your place…you thinking, maybe… (gestures with hands, back and forth) huh-huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, I don’t know… (gestures) huh-huh… but I’m hoping (gestures) huh-huh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m telling you, that monkey is a chick magnet! She’s going to take one look at his furry, cute little face and it’ll seal the deal.

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Marcel is hanging from Celia’s hair, and she is screaming, trying to get him off.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Celia, don’t worry! Don’t scream! He’s not going to hurt you! Soothing tones, Celia. Soothing tones! Marcel…

content.speaker: Celia
content.text: I can’t stand this! He’s got his claws in my…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright… (lifts Marcel away)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there but Ross and Chandler. Monica is making food, and having everyone try it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, try this salmon mousse.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Mmmm. Good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is it better than the other salmon mousse?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s creamier.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, well, is that better ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. We’re talking about whipped fish, Monica. I’m just happy I’m keeping it down, y’know?
(Chandler kicks the door closed, angrily. His clothes are askew, he looks beat.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: My God! What happened to you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Eight and a half hours of aptitude tests, intelligence tests, personality tests… and what do I learn? (he taps the results and reads them) “You are ideally suited for a career in data processing for a large multinational corporation.”

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s so great! ’Cause you already know how to do that!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Can you believe it? I mean, don’t I seem like somebody who should be doing something really cool ? You know, I just always pictured myself doing something…something.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Chandler, I know, I know… oh, hey! You can see your nipples through this shirt!
content.parenthetical: comes up and rubs him on the chest

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here you go, maybe this’ll cheer you up.
content.parenthetical: brings a plate of tiny appetizers over

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ooh, you know, I had a grape about five hours ago, so I’d better split this with you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s supposed to be that small. It’s a pre-appetizer. The French call it an amouz-bouche.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well… it is amouz-ing…
(Phone rings. Monica answers it.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Oh, hi Wendy! (Listens) Yeah, eight o’clock. (Listens) What did we say? Ten dollars an hour?… (Listens) OK, great. (Listens) All right, I’ll see you then. Bye. (hangs up)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ten dollars an hour for what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I asked one of the waitresses at work if she’d help me out.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Waitressing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well… of course I thought of you! But… but…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But, but?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But, you see, it’s just… this night has to go just perfect, you know? And, well, Wendy’s more of a… professional waitress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I see. And I’ve sort of been maintaining my amateur status so that I can waitress in the Olympics.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I don’t mean to brag, but I waited tables at Innsbruck in ‘76. (dead silence) Amouz-bouche ? (holds out tray)

content.description: [Scene: Ross’ apartment, Girl, You’ll Be A Woman Soon (the original, not that cruddy Urge Overkill version) is playing. Ross and Celia are kissing passionately.]

content.speaker: Celia
content.text: Talk to me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK… um, a weird thing happened to me on the train this morning…

content.speaker: Celia
content.text: No no no. Talk… dirty.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wha… what, here?

content.speaker: Celia
content.text: Yes…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ah…

content.speaker: Celia
content.text: Say something… hot .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Er… um…

content.speaker: Celia
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um… uh… vulva.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Ross are there, discussing what happened last night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Vulva ?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, I panicked, alright? She took me by surprise. You know, but it wasn’t a total loss. I mean, we ended up cuddling.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoaa!! You cuddled? How many times??

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Shut up! It was nice. I just… I don’t think I’m the dirty-talking kind of guy, you know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the big deal? You just say what you want to do to her. Or what you want her to do to you. Or what you think other people might be doing to each other. I’ll tell you what. Just try something on me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Please be kidding.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why not? Come on! Just, just close your eyes and tell me what you’d like to be doing right now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK. (closes eyes) I’m in my apartment…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …yeah… what else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s it. I’m in my apartment, you’re not there, we’re not having this conversation. (gets up, walks across room)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, look, I’ll start, OK?
content.parenthetical: walks to catch up to him

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, please.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on. Come on. Alright, ready, look! (in a low voice) Oh… Ross… you get me so hot. I want your lips on me now .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, now you say something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I… ahem… I really don’t think so.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on! You like this woman, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You want to see her again, right?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well if you can’t talk dirty to me, how’re you going to talk dirty to her? Now tell me you want to caress my butt!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: OK, turn around. (Joey looks taken aback) I just don’t want you staring at me when I’m doing this.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, alright. I’m around. Go ahead.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ahem… I want… OK, I want to… feel your… hot, soft skin with my lips.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There you go! Keep going. Keep going!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I, er…
(At this point, Chandler walks into the living room from his bedroom. Ross and Joey both have their backs to him, so they don’t notice. Chandler sees the situation and remains quiet, watching.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I want to take my tongue… and…
(Chandler is completely astounded.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …and…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Say it… say it!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …run it all over your body until you’re… trembling with… with…
(Chandler leans back against the wall and Ross and Joey hear him. Ross and Joey both notice at the same time. They slowly stop, and then very slowly turn around to see Chandler staring at them.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …with??

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Funny story!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re not going to believe this!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s OK. It’s OK. I was always rooting for you two kids to get together.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Chandler, while you were sleeping that guy from your old job called again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Again?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And again, and again, and again… (phone rings, he answers) Hello? (hands phone to Chandler) And again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Mr. Kostelic! How’s life on the fifteenth floor? (Listens) Yeah, I miss you too. (Listens) Yeah, it’s a lot less satisfying to steal pens from your own home, you know? (Listens) Well, that’s very generous (Listens) er, but look, this isn’t about the money. I need something that’s more than a job. I need something I can really care about… (Listens) And that’s on top of the yearly bonus structure you mentioned earlier? (Listens) Look, Al, Al… I’m not playing hardball here, OK? This is not a negotiation, this is a rejection! (Listens) No! No! No, stop saying numbers! I’m telling you, you’ve got the wrong guy! You’ve got the wrong guy! (Listens) I’ll see you on Monday! (slams the phone down)

content.description: Chandler’s new window office, he is showing Phoebe around.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! It’s huge! It’s so much bigger than the cubicle. Oh, this is a cube.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look at this! (he opens the curtain to a view of New York City)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! You have a window!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes indeedy! (they look outside) With a beautiful view of…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh look! That guy’s peeing!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, that’s enough of the view. Check this out, look at this. Sit down, sit down.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: This is great! (he presses a button on his intercom) Helen, could you come in here for a moment?
(An unamused woman walks into the office.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you Helen, that’ll be all.
(She leaves, obviously perturbed.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Last time I do that, I promise.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is on the phone. Rachel walks in and overhears the conversation.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wendy, we had a deal! (Listens) Yeah, you promised! Wendy! Wendy! Wendy! (hangs up)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Who was that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wendy bailed. I have no waitress.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh… that’s too bad. Bye bye. (she walks away towards the door)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ten dollars an hour.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Twelve dollars an hour.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mon. I wish I could, but I’ve made plans to walk around.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, Rachel, when you ran out of your wedding, I was there for you. I put a roof over your head, and if that means nothing to you… (Rachel isn’t buying it, desperate) twenty dollars an hour.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Done.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, later. Rachel is waitressing, Monica is cooking. Phoebe walks in with Steve (Crystal Duck winner Jon Lovitz).]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well hello! Welcome to Monica’s. May I take your coat?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi Steve!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Hello, Monica. (to Rachel) Hello, greeter girl.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is Rachel.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Yeah, OK.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mmmmmm! Everything smells so delicious! You know, I can’t remember a time I smelt such a delicious combination of (Monica signals her to stop) of, OK, smells.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: It’s a lovely apartment.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, thank you. Would you like a tour?

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: I was just being polite, but, alright.
(They leave on the tour and Rachel goes to follow them but Phoebe stops her and drags her into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: In the cab, on the way over, Steve blazed up a doobie.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Smoked a joint? You know, lit a bone? Weed? Hemp? Ganja?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, OK. I’m with you, Cheech. OK.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Is it dry in here? (licks his lips)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let me, let me get you some wine!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I think we’re ready for our first course. (Steve sits, Monica brings over a tray) OK, um, these are rot-shrimp ravioli, and celantro pondou sauce… (Steve starts to eat them one by one, quickly)… with just a touch of mints… and… (he finishes)… ginger.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Well, smack my ass and call me Judy! These are fantastic!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m so glad you liked them!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Like ’em? I could eat a hundred of them!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, well… um, that’s all there are of these. But in about eight and a half minutes, we’ll be serving some delicious onion tartlets.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Tartlets. Tartlets. Tartlets. The word has lost all meaning. (he gets up and goes into the kitchen)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me? Can I help you with anything?

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: You know, I don’t know what I’m looking for.

(Rachel tries to get Monica’s attention to tell her Steve is stoned. She pretends to drag on a joint, and Monica thinks she’s giving her the ‘OK’ signal. Then Rachel does it again, inhaling deeply this time. Monica waves it off as though she doesn’t believe it.)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Ah, cool! Taco shells! (Rachel motions, “You see!”) You know, these are… they’re like a little corn envelope.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know that? You don’t want to spoil your appetite.
content.parenthetical: joining him and taking the taco shells

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Hey! Sugar-O’s! (grabs the cereal box)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know, if you just wait another… six and a half minutes…

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Macaroni and cheese! We gotta make this!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, we don’t. (reaches for box)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Oh, OK. (he drops the box on the floor) Oh, sorry. (When she bends down to pick it up he grabs a package of Gummi-bears from the cabinet.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just have a seat here? (he sits at the table, then tries to secretly eat the Gummi-bears. Monica spots him.) OK… give me the Gummi-bears.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Give them to me.

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Alright, we’ll share.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, give me the…

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Well then you can’t have any. (she grabs for the package, and it breaks open. Gummi-bears fly everywhere, some into the punch bowl on the table.) Bear overboard! I think he’s drowning. (he throws some Sugar-O’s into the punch bowl) Hey fellows! Grab on a Sugar-O… save yourself! (Mimicking the bears) “Help! I’m drowning! Help!”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s it! Dinner is over!

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why? It’s just that I’ve waited seven years for an opportunity like this, and you can’t even wait four and a half minutes for a stupid onion tartlet?
(The oven goes off.)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Hey!

content.description: Central Perk, all are there except Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What a tool!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You don’t want to work for a guy like that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know… it’s just… I thought this was, you know… it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, you’ll get there. You’re an amazing chef.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! You know all those yummy noises? I wasn’t faking.
(Ross gets up and goes over to the counter and Joey follows him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So, er… how did it go with Celia?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I was unbelievable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was the James Michener of dirty talk. It was the most elaborate filth you have ever heard. I mean, there were characters, plot lines, themes, a motif… at one point there were villagers.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! And the… (gestures with hands) huh-huh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, ahem… you know, by the time we’d finished with all the dirty talk, it was kinda late… and we were both kind of exhausted, so uh…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You cuddled.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, which was nice.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys wanna try and catch a late movie or something?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Maybe, but shouldn’t we wait for Chandler?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, where the hell is he?

content.description: Chandler’s office, he’s on the phone, agitated.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, Fran. I know what time it is, but I’m looking at the WENUS and I’m not happy!… (Listens) Oh, really, really, really? Well, let me tell you something… you will care about it, because I care about it! You got it? Good! (slams phone down, then leans back and realizes what just happened) Whooooaaaa…

content.description: Phoebe’s massage parlour, she has Steve on the table, and is giving him an extra-painful massage.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: How’s this? (presses down hard)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Eeeee!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Sorry. How about over here? (presses down hard again)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Aaaaah!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: See, that just means it’s working. Does this hurt? (presses down elsewhere)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What about this? (she starts using her elbows on his back, he yells in pain)

content.speaker: Steve
content.text: Aaaaahhh!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: There you go! (She continues to work him over with her elbows and he continues to yell in pain.)
